name: Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast
description: French toast topped with glazed strawberries and stuffed with cheesecake. Soooo good and original. Perfect to impress at a brunch. Serve with mimosas for a fancier brunch-type setting, or just make it for a special Saturday morning breakfast for your family like I do. =)
recipeIngredient: 8 slices bread, cut in half diagonally

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 100 degrees F ( 40 degrees C).
Heat mashed strawberries and 1/2 cup white sugar in a saucepan over medium heat.
Mix cornstarch and water together in a bowl, then stir into the strawberries.
Cook and stir until thickened, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer while preparing remaining ingredients, stirring occasionally.
Whisk together the milk and eggs in a bowl; set aside.
Mash cream cheese, vanilla extract, and 3/4 cup white sugar in a bowl until smooth.
Spread the cream cheese mixture over a triangle-shaped piece of bread, and top with another piece. Repeat with remaining bread and cream cheese mixture to make 8 triangle-shaped sandwiches.
Heat butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
Dip the sandwiches into the egg mixture, 2 or 3 at a time, and place in the skillet.
Cook until golden brown on both sides, about 3 minutes per side.
Transfer pan-fried sandwiches to a baking sheet and place in the preheated oven to keep warm while cooking remaining sandwiches.
To serve, top French toast with warm strawberry glaze and sliced fresh strawberries and sprinkle with confectioners' sugar. Serve with a dollop of whipped cream.

review.reviewBody: Thanks for sharing this tasty recipe. I wanted to make something new for breakfast today...and this certainly hit the spot. The entire family loved this, and was easy to make. The only thing I changed was using my griddle for all the toast at a time, rather than 1 at a time in a skillet. A+++

This was really good, and not hard to make. I think the time estimate is pretty accurate. The cream cheese filling was grainy from the sugar, not smooth and creamy like I had expected, but it was still good. Definitely take the serving size seriously here! It is very rich and sweet, and I cannot imagine eating more than 1/8 of this recipe (one half sandwich).
I made this for my husband for his birthday breakfast. This was sooo good! Perfect amount of sweetness.

A quote from my 8 & 12 year old "this is off the hook good mom" "can you please make it for us again". This was a huge hit by all.

I did make a couple changes as well. First I used frozen peaches,  all I had. I loved the fruit topping! You don't need any syrup. Actually, I tried some syrup with too and didn't like the way it changed the flavor! 

I also addes some cinnamon to the egg mixture,  seemed to just go perfect with the peaches.

Next I used confection sugar with the cream cheese which made it smooth. I also spread the cream cheese on one slice of bread then topped it with second slice and then cut the bread diagionally. Seemed a bit easier. 

I too used more than 8 slices, I think we used 13. I still had egg mixture left. I made baked oatmeal the next day with it, it was yummy too.

We totally forgot to use the whipping cream on top, it was so good even without it.

This was awesome - thanks for sharing your recipe!

yum!  i made this for myself and my 1 year old, who doesn't eat much refined sugar.  i replaced the sugar with half the amount of maple syrup everywhere it was called for.  i also used frozen strawberries because that's what i had on hand and omitted the whipped cream.  even with these modifications, this is a 5 star recipe!  (but i'm sure it would look a lot prettier with the powdered sugar and whipped cream on it :)

What a hit! My husband ate double the helpings, and he is not a sweet tooth breakfast kind of guy!! I used powdered sugar in the cream cheese filling, and we had enough filling and eggs for 12 slices! We had no whipping cream, but we didn't miss it. I think we'll try it next time with blueberries :)

My family could not get enough of this!  2 things though,  I think this would be better with thicker texas cut bread and I think the egg mixture could be reduced by half as I had a lot left over. I followed the recipe exactly and it is a keeper!
I used brioche instead of plain bread it was really good!

All combined, this recipe is really, really good and very hard for anyone not to like it, especially if you love sweets.  That being said, I must say that I was less than impressed with the strawberry sauce.  It was pale, opaque, and tasted more like sugar and cornstarch than it did strawberries.  I tried adding red food coloring, but stopped after it became apparent that I was going to have to add more than desirable.  I’m thinking frozen strawberries might work better for the sauce, but there are better strawberry sauces out there.
Absolutely delicious!  I cut back a little on the sugar in the cream cheese filling and used fresh sour dough bread, and boy was it good!
Made this for company. Thought it might be too icky sweet, but it was not.  Fabulous recipe and pretty, too.

Awesome! Made a few changes: confectioner's sugar instead of regular sugar for mixing w/ the cream cheese (light); bananas and pancake syrup on top instead of strawberries. I used Martin's whole wheat potato bread-fiber and protein! Thanks for the recipe.

A great stuffed french toast recipe that doesn't need to soak for hours or bake for a long time.  Results were fantastic and easy to do all at once  on an electric griddle.  I used homemade strawberry rhubarb sauce inside the "sandwiches" and served on top.  French bread makes big fluffy servings, but regular bread works well also.  Very adaptable to any fruit on hand.  Thanks for sharing a great idea!
I hollowed out bakery hamburger buns and stuffed them with the filling and topped them with the strawberries. I did add cinnamon to the eggs. My family LOVED this!

Oh good Lord. YUM. That's about all I can say. I had cream cheese stuffed french toast once in my life at IHOP, and this recipe is right on par with it. This is so simple to prepare and cook, and it looks very elegant when it's all put together. Like a lot of people said, this french toast is very filling and one little triangle of this will probably do the trick to fill you up, especially if you serve it with coffee, juice, or fresh berries on the side. I thought I would add this note: To cut a few calories, you can also just spread light cream cheese or Neufchatel cheese between the slices of bread instead of mixing in the sugar/vanilla mixture, and instead of putting butter in the pan to brown the toast, use a no calorie PAM spray and leave out topping your toast with whipped cream. Absolutely wonderful recipe. I will be making this again!
Really good, made it last weekend and my boyfriend demanded it again for his birthday this weekend. He says this is best yet, even better than the baked creme brulee french toast.

We liked this recipe, but I wasn't as overwhelmed as I thought I would be.  I also had leftover milk/egg mixture and cream cheese filling.  Made some extra toasts, then scrambled eggs.  The filling oozed out and made it not look too pretty.  My strawberry sauce didn't thicken much--I would bring to full boil next time.  I used our whole wheat bread that we always have.  I am sure I could tweak this and with some practice it would be awesome, but we just don't eat unhealthy all that often.  I made this to use up a bulk of strawberries from our garden, and it did the trick.  Thanks for submitting!  Oh, I originally forgot the confection's sugar--it really made a difference (improvement) when I added.  I left off whipped cream.

I made this the other night, my husband was weary, he kept saying just make regular french toast and to his dismay it was so very very good! He ate 3rd's maybe even more. The kids all ate it up too there were NO left overs and they are already asking for it again! Great recipe! I used frozen fruit for the topping, it's what I had on hand so it was a mixture of pineapple, mango, strawberries and peaches. Smashed them up while cooking and it was a very tasty topping!

This was absolutely fabulous!  Made it for Sunday brunch for my brother and his wife and there wasn't a crumb left!  Followed the recipe exactly and the strawberry glaze was perfect.  Used cheap white bread and it was still delicious!

Oh my goodness! I'm sure I've never rated any food items but i had too rate this! I don't even like French toast abs it was amazing. I replaced the granulated sugar in the cream cheese mix with powder sugar and used Texas toast but did everything else the same. Fantastic! If you're on the edge of whether or not you should make it, definitely do! Amazing!

This is a very easy recipe to make and my bf loved it! Made it for valentine's day. He said it comes very close to his all-time favorite dessert: mille-feuilles! don't know if I'll ever be able to make that though (lol) but I sure can make this one!  his brother and sister loved it as well.THank youuuuu :)

Absolutely the Best French toast recipe you will ever find! My children would not eat French toast until I made this recipe. I have had to share the recipe with every person who I have made this for. So easy to make all at once on the griddle. The syrup is fantastic as well. You can use any berry you prefer. Yumm yumm!
I used mascarpone instead of cream
Was very good. Woke the girlfriend up with a random breakfeast one more and she loved it. Note to readers: This will get you FULL! So plan on having extras at the end. Good recipe, will make again!

I followed the recipe as is and it tasted exactly like I expected: a french toast strawberry cheesecake.  I actually liked it with maple syrup more so than with the strawberry glaze (but that's just me).  I think this would be a fun Saturday morning breakfast for kids.

I made this for my kids on Valentine's Day. It was AMAZING! They all said it was the best french toast they'd ever had. I completely agree. I made it exactly the way it was written. I wouldn't change a thing! I will be making it again soon!
It was amazing. My family loved it. I followed the recipe step by step and it worked perfectly. Thanks for the recipe. :)
Very easy to make! The whole family loves it, it's perfect to make for breakfast on weekends. And if you don't want to make the strawberry glaze that goes along with it, regular syrup is just fine!

This was delicious! I made these for my daughter's 30th Bday breakfast and everyone loved them. After reading comments from others I decided to use powdered sugar (1/2c) with the lowfat version of crm cheese so it wasn't gritty. I used 1.5T & 3/4 c water to thicken the strawberry glaze and used French bread. I used a few less egg yolks and added more egg whites to reduce the cholesterol. Had enough egg/milk mixture left over to make several slices of traditional French toast. This will definitely remain in my recipe box! Thanks for the great recipe.

Holy moly! This recipe is great! I made these as a surprise breakfast for my boyfriend. He cannot stop
talking about them. He also said he can't eat regular french toast anymore because nothing compares to this. I agree with another reviewer A++ recipe. Yum!

This is my new favorite french toast.  I made small changes...I used 1/2 cup of sugar in the cream cheese mixture which made it pefectly in the sweetness factor.  I also used french bread, but there was so much cream cheese that I ended up needing 12 slices.  I also had an opened can of blueberry pie filling and it just made the morning.

Amazing.  Made this for my girlfriend and I and be forewarned:  This is RICH.  That being said, it was delicious and we weren't able to finish half of the recipe between the two of us...definitely a repeat.

My family absolutely loved this! Made just as the recipe called for. The only change I might make next time is to cut down on the eggs or milk. Seemed like a lot left over after making the french toast. Either that or make more french toast!!
Easy and delicious!
Loved the taste... Though i did add some vanilla to the milk and egg mix. Also, used butter spray and turned out fine...

For the most part I made the recipe as was. The only thing I changed was I used powdered sugar in the cream cheese mixture because many of the reviewers complained about it having a grainy texture. Mine came out perfect! Nice and smooth and creamy.

All I can say is delicious. I mean deeeeelllllliiiicccciiiooouuussss. When it was time to stir the sugar in the cream cheese I didn't use as much because I knew it was going to be to sweet. I just use 2/4 cups instead. I put the cream cheese in the microwave for 10 seconds to soften it so it can spread better. When I tell you every Fridays morning my family request this for breakfast over anything. Great recipe
Thank you all for trying this out! I love all of the input and have since tried this different ways. ????
LOVED IT!!!! My husband said it tasted as good as something you would get at Ihop.

What a glorious way to start your day! I made it exactly as written. At least on my oven, it took much longer than 5 minutes for the strawberry sauce to thicken. Other than that, perfection. For what it's worth, there was PLENTY of strawberry sauce, as well as the cream cheese filling. (I spread the cream cheese fairly thinly on both sides of the triangle!) Thank you.

This was sooo yummy! I used more fresh strawberries for the sauce than called for, and didn't bother with the whipped cream or powdered sugar.  I also used cheap sliced bread, and put a little bit of flour in egg mix - also some cinnamon as you can't have french toast without cinnamon!  Definitely substitute powdered/icing sugar for the white sugar in the cream cheese, makes it smooth.  For those who think this might be too sickly sweet, I found this to be less sweet than using traditional maple syrup.  Highly recommended and fairly easy to make

Oh my… simply decadent, I would say! I made it today for Easter breakfast and it was a hit! My family absolutely, positively loved it! I tweaked it a bit though. I used only four eggs, added cinnamon to the egg mixture and added powdered sugar to the cream cheese instead of granulated sugar. These were so yummy! I definitely will make again, thank you!

I tried this recipe and it came out great.  I ended up using challah bread and it worked perfectly and turned out to be the best french toast i have ever made and also the i have ever tasted.  This all cooks pretty fast if you prep stuff the night before.  You can also try using banana's on top instead of strawberries.  I also dusted the top with cinnamon in addition to the powdered sugar.

Whittleberry Out
Use powder sugar instead of white :)
I halved both sets of sugar and the dish was still perfect.
Omg this is delicious!!! I didn't have any berries, so I omitted that part, and had to cut down the recipe to suit, but wow!! I'll be making this again and again!! Next time I'll use the berries!!
Loved it! And yes, I will be making this again.
My whole family loves this!!! We have substituted the strawberries with frozen blueberries many times and it's amazing

This was good but really sweet. I found the directions a little unclear as to how much cream cheese  to spread on each piece and subsequently had a bunch left over but that just meant more French toast!  I will make this again but cut way back on the sugar.
I loved it, I mean it was delicious. The best French toast I've made my husband says, and he wont have it another way. This recipe is definitely a must try recipe.
I made this recipe as written. I made this for Father's Day, and it was a hit! Very yummy!
This was so easy and delicious, my children beg me to make this at least once a month.
I made this for a weekend treat with a ham and cheese omlette and some sausage links to offset the sweetness! There were no left overs for sure! And we'll be making this again to be sure!
This Recipe was amazing! I made it for my family of four and they all thought it was delicious. It's very easy and quick to prepare
Really good and really healthy thanks to you now I know what to do

Made this today and it was absolutely delicious and pretty simple to make. I did use powdered sugar with the cream cheese instead of regular and added a little cinnamon to the eggs. I also used Sara Lee artesano bread, but any thicker bread will do. Definitely a show stopper.

Concept is great but a few pieces of the execution could use tweaking IMO. The level of sweetness here is clearly a matter of personal preference, because SO many reviewers said this was the right amount of sweetness, but I found it to be too over the top sweet. And the sauce didn’t quite come together as I hoped either, I think I would put more strawberries in and maybe keep them sliced or chopped instead of mashed
So yummy!

I will add a little salt to the milk and egg mixture. Maybe to the cream cheese as well. I used peaches instead of strawberries, because that was all that I had. It still turned out great. I bet you could use blueberries, blackberries, apples, etc, as well.

Whole family loved it, including my picky 14 & 11 year old daughters.  I used thick slices of egg twist bread, and it held up very well. I kept the slices whole, and not cut diagonally, and didn't spread the filling to the very edges, so no leakage of the filling while cooking. For the strawberry sauce, next time I'll use 1 lb. of fresh strawberries, but keep the rest of the sauce ingredients the same. Based on other reviews, I used confectioner's sugar in the cream cheese filling (1/2 cup), and cinnamon in the egg dip. Also, 4 eggs and 3/4 milk was enough. The pieces cooked beautifully in a cast iron pan. Added Reddi Whip topping for a nice presentation. There was one piece left, and I'm sneaking it right now! Thanks. Pamela, for the great recipe!

I used powdered sugar in place of sugar.  I cut down the milk ALOT, probably only 1/3 cup of milk!!! Just made it like normal French toast.  I used homemade strawberry jam instead of the strawberry topping, why mess with making jam when I already had it made!!!  No whipping cream needed! Nor did we have any! We used left over cheesecake middle to add to the top also, I may not have stuffed mine as full as suggested! So very delish!!!  Mine made 9 1/2 full sandwiches, I used all the egg up.

I liked the  individual components of this recipe .  The cream cheese mixture and the strawberry compote. But the French toast concept is a bit too  mushy for me.   I rather just make cheesecake!  or bread pudding.  But for those people who love French toast, this may be ideal for you.
great for brunch, I cut back the sugar by 1/4 cup. Came out perfect, not too sweet, paired with bacon for salty and sweet deliciousness.
Thanks for sharing. Made these for my wife on Mothers day. She absolutely loved it. As did everybody else in the family.
Really tasty! I thought that the recipe made a bit too much of the cream cheese mixture per french toast sandwich.

It was delicious. I used a combination of fresh strawberries and frozen mixed berries to make the sauce.
Also, I made chocolate cream cheese.
The crowd went wild
I enjoyed this recipe, reduced the sugar and added a little lemon juice.  Came out like toaster strudel filling.
Awesome!!
Used sour cream & chives. Use less sugar for strawberry sauce
Delicious!!
Heavenly.  Not a quick recipe, but well worth the time.

This was delicious! Very very sweet though! I'd definitely recommend having this as a side rather than the main part of your breakfast. My girlfriend the gritty cream cheese problem by mixing that part in a bowl surrounded by hot water in my sink.
Super easy and delicious.  Only change I made was to use powdered sugar and less than the granulated.
My family and I love this recipe. We will make this a standard family breakfast at our house. Thanks so much for sharing!

So yummy!  My husband and I really loved these for breakfast!  I pretty much went by the recipe except changed a few things around.  First I used powdered sugar in the cream cheese mixture instead of sugar.  I also halved the egg/milk mixture since it made plenty enough for 10 slices of bread.  I also always add in a pinch of cinnamon, sugar, and vanilla in with the egg mixture.  I also did not do the step of layering the bread with the cream cheese mixture before cooking.  I dipped the bread slices and made the french toast on our griddle like normal, that way both slices of french toast are cooked up.  Then I layered with the cream cheese between each piece, and layered with the rest of the toppings.  These were super yummy and filling.  Thank you for the recipe!

It was very good but next time I would lower the amount of sugar added to the cream cheese filling as I found too sweet.
Also, this recipe yielded 12 sandwiches instead of 8. The strawberry glaze was enough for 12 sandwiches too.

Although a bit overwhelmingly sweet the first time I made this (i made this for 4 triangle sandwiches instead of 8) so while i cut the sugar to suit for the strawberry glaze.. I got a bit side tracked and failed to cut the sugar for the cream cheese mixture.. OOPS! Toothache city sweet.. So the second time I did NOT forget and results were so much better.. Loved it and can't wait to make it again.

Awesome recipe. Took the advice of another reviewer and use powdered sugar instead of white sugar for the cream cheese spread. I used the thicker Texas Toast bread and it turned out excellent. Thank you!
Really good,  but I would have liked it better with more whole strawberries in the sauce rather than mashed
This is delicious! My family gobbled it up and promptly asked me to make it again for another breakfast. I didn't change anything about this meal

This was a hit for Mother's Day, with a couple of changes.
Added homemade strawberry jam to the cream cheese to add strawberry flavor.    Added some red food color to the glaze to improve the color.   Cooked the French toast separate to get some crust on both sides.  Assembled cream cheese cheese between two slices of French toast, and topped with glaze, whipped cream , sliced fresh strawberries and powder sugar

Next time I will let the French toast cool just a minute so it will not melt the cream cheese and whip cream so fast

Tried this recipe this morning and it was wonderful.  Not to sweet like some of them. I used a cinnamon raisin bread to make it on. I did double the sauce part and left out the whip creme. lol My husband love it also.
Absolutely delicious, I used raspberries rather than strawberries out of personal preference.  I also substituted for powdered sugar in the cream cheese.
Super easy and delicious.  Only change I made was to use powdered sugar and less than the granulated.
made this for a special brunch and the entire family went crazy!  It was an amazing flavor combination.  going to try it with real french bread next time for a super special treat!
This recipe was outstanding I made it for my wife for mother’s day and it was enjoyed by all

Mothers Day breakfast was a hit for my wife and my adult boys.  Switch everything to powder sugar.  Use Texas toast, for sure.  Then you can cook on all five sides flipping with tongs.  Next time I'll make the whipped cream and glaze before hand so they can both cool and firm up.
I'm not crazy about sweets but this was right about max for me.  Next time I'll orange zest the glaze, or throw in whatever other berries I have around.

Easy & delicious.  I halved all the sugars and it was plenty sweet and flavorful.  Made getting up on a weekday easier for Dad and the teenagers.  A very pretty & presentable recipe for company or special occasion like Mother's Day (hint. hint.)
Family loves it! Very easy to make. Wouldnt change a thing.

Enjoyed it very much, especially the grandson. Used Sara Lee's artisan bread and the confectioners sugar as recommended.  I did cut back a little bit on sugar and glad of it.  Husband recommended blueberries next time and cant wait to try it for whole family on our beach vaca.
I made this for Mothers’Day.  It was a hit.  The sauce  was  especially a  hit.  I will definitely make this again.

My family really liked this.  I only changed minor things, such as using 4 eggs and 3/4 milk for the dip (and I still had some left over)  and I made 12 sandwiches and had plenty of filling.  I cooked at 300 degrees on my griddle and I was able to cook them all at  the same time, so I didn't use the oven.  I cooked them for about 6-8 minutes per side to make sure all of the egg was cooked--I'm not a fan of soggy french toast, but that wasn't a problem.

Delicious!!! My husband was impressed he said it was restaurant quality :) I put a teaspoon of the strawberry glaze on top of the cream cheese filling for each sandwich I made. Definitely will make again & again!!
I MADE THIS FOR MOTHERS DAY FOR MYSELF
Very tasty but wow! What a boatload of sugar.

I made this using Dave's Good Seed bread. 
I halved all the sugar in the recipe and substituted confectioners sugar for granulated sugar in the cream cheese. There was enough cream cheese mix and egg/ milk mix to use ~12 slices of bread. I also used frozen mango cubes instead of strawberries--what I had on hand. Also, no whip.
This was a hit with everyone.
Made it for husband's B-day breakfast, and they were great!!!!!
Wonderfully delicious! I will make it again and recommend it to anyone who likes a sweet french toast.
Made for Easter brunch...nothing but rave reviews!!
